doc.title: Jefferies
doc.source_uri: 2025-09-02/2Q in Line Initiating on Sanhua-H at Buy2Q in Line Initiating on Sanhua-H at Buy_2025-09-02

passages.text: ASIA-PACIFIC excl. Japan | Autos & Auto Parts

Sanhua reported 2Q25 revenue of RMB8.6bn, up 19% YoY, and earnings of RMB1.2mn, up 39% YoY, in line with preliminary results. We joined Sanhua's post-result group call. Key messages include: 1) internal cost-saving measures drove the net margin up to 14.1% in 2Q; 2) Thailand factory for humanoid robots is scheduled to start production in 3Q; 3) revenue from liquid cooling logged >RMB1bn in 2024. We initiate on Sanhua-H at Buy with a PT of HKD38.1/sh.

·By segment: 1) The Refrigeration segment achieved revenue of RMB5.4bn, up 23% YoY, and net profit of RMB753mn, up 55% YoY, driven by trade-in subsidies for home appliances in China, strong commercial HVAC demand overseas, and some rush export orders; 2) The Auto Component segment reported revenue of RMB3.2bn, up 13% YoY,and net profit of RMB450mn, up 18% YoY. The revenue contribution from Tesla declined to c.29% of total revenue, vs 35% last year, while contributions from Xiaomi, Leapmotor, Geely, and GM grew significantly.

·2Q GPM posted a 2.4ppt QoQ uptick to 29.3%, which surprised us, thanks to the cost-control measures and increasing scale effect. The SG&A and R&D expense to sales ratios declined to 7.1%/4.0% in 2Q25, down 0.8pct/0.7pct QoQ and 1.7pct/0.4pct YoY,respectively, driven by the company's "Elite Force Initiative," launched in 2H24. Net margin rose to 14.1% in 2Q25, up 2.1pct/2.0pct QoQ/YoY.

**The company raised full-year guidance.** A/C business: Given the strong growth in 1H25, mgmt raised its full-year revenue guidance to 15%+ YoY and net profit growth to 20-30%+ YoY in 2025, driven by increasing demand from low A/C penetration regions such as Europe, Africa,and India, as well as strong demand in AIDC liquid cooling and energy storage space. Auto TMS business: Mgmt sees sales picking up and maintains the target of 20% YoY in 2025.

**Updates on humanoid robots.** The company remains optimistic about the humanoid robot industry, viewing it as the largest application for AI. The Thailand factory is scheduled to begin production in 3Q25. The company indicated that it maintains a solid position in its customers' supply chains.

**Management** **disclosed** that revenue from liquid cooling reached RMB1bn in 2024. Notably, nearly half of the discussion during the company earnings call focused on AIDC liquid cooling.The company believes the core technology behind AIDC liquid cooling lies in heat pump system. Key components include compressors, refrigerants, CDU, and CDU components such as valves, pumps, and heat exchangers, which are all Sanhua's flagship products. Customer-wise, Sanhua has supplied components to NVIDIA as a tier-2 supplier.

**We initiate on Sanhua-H at Buy with a PT of HKD38.1.** We raised our earnings forecast for 2025/2026 to factor in strong 1H results and better-than-expected margin. Our PT of RMB36.9 for Sanhua H is based on 35x 2026E PE. Our PT for Sanhua-H is based on a 5% discount for the H share vs A share.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 6-11 of this report. * Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

**Xiaoyi Lei*|Equity Analyst**
**Johnson Wan*|Equity Analyst**

Investment Thesis / Where We DifferFounded in 1984, Sanhua is a proven leader of thermal management, with a competitive edge in valve and pump products. Over the past several years, Sanhua has been riding on the tailwinds of growing EVs around the globe, transferring from a refrigeration component supplier to a leading auto component supplier on the back of a solid carmaker customer base, including Tesla, BYD, and Li Auto. Meanwhile, leveraging the moat in TMS, Sanhua is also moving into ESS and the humanoid robot industry.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, CNY36.9, \(+16\%\)
We value Sanhua based on 35x 2026E P/E, giving us a PT of Rmb36.9/HKD38.1 for Sanhua A/H.
Upside Scenario, CNY42.3, \(+33\%\)
Our bull case of Rmb42.3/HKD43.7 is based on 40x 2026E P/E for Sanhua A/H.
Downside Scenario, CNY21.1, \(- 34\%\)
Our bear case of Rmb21.1/HKD21.8 is based on 15x 2026E P/E for Sanhua A/H.

1. Emission management: In routine work and operations, Sanhua needs to pay attention to energy conservation and consumption reduction and create environmental-friendly conditions in production.  
2. Data security is a vital ESG issue. Sanhua should comply with related regulations and actively conduct internal training for privacy protection.
1. Achieve carbon peak by 2030 and carbon neutrality by 2060 alongside China's decarbonization goal

1. How do you motivate employee innovation?  
2. How much have you invested in energy consumption reduction in production?
Investment Thesis / Where We Differ

Founded in 1984, Sanhua is a proven leader of thermal management with a competitive edge in valve and pump products. After the past several years, Sanhua has been riding on the tailwinds growing EVs around the globe, transferring from a refrigeration component supplier to a leading auto component supplier on the back of a solid carmaker customer base including Tesla, BYD and Li Auto. Meanwhile, leveraging the moat in TMS, Sanhua is also moving into ESS and the humanoid robot industry.
Rsk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, HK\$38.1, +22%
We value Sanhua based on 35x 2026E P/E, giving us a PT of Rmb36.9/HKD38.1 for Sanhua A/H.
Upside Scenario, HK\$43.7, +40%
Our bull case of Rmb42.3/HKD43.7 is based on 40x 2026E P/E for Sanhua A/H.
Downside Scenario, HK\$21.8, - 30%
Our bear case of Rmb21.1/HKD21.8 is based on 15x 2026E P/E for Sanhua A/H.

1. Emissions management: In routine work and operations, Sanhua must focus on energy conservation and consumption reduction and create environmentally friendly conditions in production.  
2. Data security is a vital ESG issue. Sanhua must comply with related regulations and actively conduct internal training for privacy protection.
1. Achieve carbon peak by 2030 and carbon neutrality by 2060 alongside China's decarbonization goal.

1. How do you motivate employee innovation?  
2. How much have you invested in energy consumption reduction in production?

- Strong volume growth of major customers  
- New progress on order wins
Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent- A (002050 CH 2050 HK / ) Equity Research September 1, 2025
Exhibit 1 - Company Snapshot - Sanhua A

SanhuaZhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co., Ltd. manufactures appliance parts. The company designs, produces, and sells shut- off, electronic expansion, electromagnetic, and other related valves. Sanhua Intelligent also produces compressors, electromechanical hydraulic control pumps, and other industry equipment throughout China.

SanhuaSanhua Intelligent Controls specializes in creating environmentally friendly thermal management solutions centered around heat transfer and intelligent temperature control. Sanhua's expertise lies in developing HVAC systems, home appliance equipment, and thermal management solutions for NEVs.
We value Sanhua based on 35x 2025E P/E, above the five- year average. Risks: lower- than- expected NEV sales; slower than expected development of humanoid robots.
For Important Disclosure information on companies recommended in this report, please visit our website at https://javatar.bluematrix.com/ sellside/Disclosures.action or call 212.284.2300.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
